column4: Is it too early for me to ask what the stance is on Unity/GNOME in 11.10?
I have seen an announcement that the Gnome desktop will not be in 11.10.  I don't know all the details.
see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/unity/+bug/739812/comments/5 for confirmation
that's interesting, but it's hardly a definitive statement on the matter
I generally take Marks word as a decision.  But, you can decide for yourself.
Oops, I didn't check the author's name
okay, I think you're right
I am concerned, too.  But, I hope not.
Seriously, Ubuntu has been the most popular distro for years now.  With this Unity business, it's finished
You are too harsh.  For the next 6 months, there is no problem.  If Uniuty bothers you, just use Gnome.  Let them work out the bugs a bit.
I'll stay with 10.04.  I'm doing coding mainly so it's not like I need a recent release

Fedora uses GNOME 3.  I agree with Mark that it was a risky choice to go with GNOME 3.  Or, at least it is fair to say it looked like that early on.  It seems to have worked out, but it has its own odd behaviours.
the current version of Fedora?
No, the one in Beta.
Okay, good.  I'm running Fedora 14 and it has GNOME 2.  I don't like the Fedora look and feel as much as Ubuntu
But if Ubuntu continues to move toward unity and away from GNOME, I'm going to Fedora or Debian
I like Ubuntu better, too.  But, if you want to try GNOME 3, thge Fedora 15 beta is a good place.
I'm coding a Wikipedia bot so I want to only use release software
I can't run my code on beta anything
GNOME 3 is very new.  So, you can try the beta or wait.
